full_description:
Energize your future and join our dynamic team dedicated to advancing renewable energy projects. We are committed to fostering a collaborative environment that promotes teamwork and a sense of responsibility.
NJR Clean Energy Ventures (CEV) is seeking a skilled Business Development Analyst to maintain our business unit's financial plan and forecast, support due-diligence efforts for solar project investments, and perform ongoing market analysis. This role involves developing and maintaining databases, financial models, and supporting executive-level communications.
Major Responsibilities:
\n
\n
Perform research and analysis on renewable energy markets and fundamentals.
\n
Develop and maintain market and project analysis tools.
\n
Maintain a strong working knowledge of energy and incentive markets (retail and wholesale).
\n
Assist with project data analysis throughout different project stages.
\n
Compile and prepare technical, statistical, and analytical reports and presentations.
\n
Assist the development team on individual projects, including due diligence and financial modeling.
\n
Maintain portfolio management tools for tracking project investments and RECs.
\n
Maintain effective internal and external contacts.
\n
Foster teamwork and a sense of responsibility.
\n
Position Requirements:
\n
\n
Bachelor’s degree in business or a related field.
\n
Experience in market and project analysis.
\n
Experience with energy markets and technologies.
\n
Strong customer focus and project development skills.
\n
Strong research and analytical skills.
\n
Ability to develop market and project financial models.
\n
Ability to focus and deliver proactively in a dynamic, multi-tasking, fast-paced environment.
\n
Demonstrated ability to influence and collaborate across organizational boundaries.
\n
Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills.
\n
Strong analytical, pattern detection, and problem-solving abilities.
\n
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.
\n
Team player with a passion to succeed and work effectively under pressure.
\n
The above job description is reflective of the primary duties of this position and in no way limits the supervisor from assigning any other duties, responsibilities or initiatives as deemed necessary.
\n
Job Location Type is Hybrid.
Other Details:
Compensation:
Expected base pay range for this role will be $76,400- $97,300.
Base pay is based on several factors including, experience, skills, and knowledge.
This role will be eligible to participate in an annual short term incentive program.
Benefits:
Medical insurance coverage from day 1; 401k vesting immediate.
\n
\n
Employee insurance and medical plans, including prescription, vision and dental benefits.
\n
401(k) program with generous company match.
\n
Company stock purchase plan.
\n
Wellness programs, including free on and off-site fitness centers.
\n
Employee Assistance Program (EAP).
\n
Tuition reimbursement program.
\n
Paid time off including paid holidays.
\n
New Jersey Resources is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity and/or expression, national origin, disability, veteran, or other protected status.
